title: SB 1.19.16-17 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 21-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: if at all he takes birth again in the material world, he desires three things.
segments.summary: Pariksit Maharaj expresses his desires for his next life, focusing on attachment to Krishna, association with devotees, and friendly relations with all beings.

segments.key_quote: a devotee of the Lord is no one's enemy, although there may be many enemies of a devotee.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada's explanation of the qualities of a devotee, emphasizing their lack of enemies, preference for devotee association, and attachment to Krishna.

segments.key_quote: It's insanity to forget Krishna, to be independent of Krishna, to disobey Krishna's instructions. It's insane.
segments.summary: The devotee's perspective on all living beings as children of Krishna, the importance of bringing others to Krishna consciousness, and the value of association with devotees regardless of material status.

segments.key_quote: Facing the north is still more favorable for attaining spiritual success.
segments.summary: Explanation of the 17th verse, detailing Pariksit Maharaj's preparations for leaving his body, including renunciation, auspicious arrangements, and facing the north for spiritual success.

segments.key_quote: Brahmana is the perfect guide for everyone in the society.
segments.summary: Discussion of the Vedic varnashrama system, the roles of Brahmanas and Kshatriyas, and Pariksit Maharaj's responsible transfer of power to his son.

segments.key_quote: That is the ultimate success of the human form of life, that one may simply aim to go back to Godhead after quitting the present body.
segments.summary: Concluding remarks on the perfection of human life, aiming to return to Godhead, and Krishna's teachings in the Bhagavad Gita.
